alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 11:30AM EDT until April 30 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southern portions of Cherokee and Spartanburg counties in the upstate of South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 AM EDT, Flood conditions continued to work downstream through the Enoree, Tyger, Pacolet and Broad River drainages, with lingering high water conditions along select tributaries such as Fairforest, Lawson`s Fork, Thicketty and Kings Creeks. Overall, river levels are expected to gradually lower in many places during the afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
